thread.title: Former LSU defensive lineman Maquedius Bain commits to UAB
thread.title_full: Former LSU defensive lineman Maquedius Bain commits to UAB

author: Drew Champlin | dchamplin@al.com
title: Former LSU defensive lineman Maquedius Bain commits to UAB
text:
Former LSU defensive lineman Maquedius Bain commits to UAB Bain.jpg Comments 
Maquedius "Quay" Bain, a defensive tackle from Pearl River Community College in Mississippi, announced that he had committed to UAB while on his official visit. 
The 6-foot-4, 300-pound Bain joins Noah Jones, his teammate at Pearl River, as UAB commitments for the midyear signing period. UAB will return to the playing field in 2017, but is signing around 15 midyear players in time for 2016 spring practice. Told lil bro lets make history again! Proud to announce I have committed to UAB #HistoryInTheMaking üîõüîùüîú pic.twitter.com/RSZ8WCfRgw 
Bain left LSU in August to transfer to Pearl River for his sophomore season. 
He was a four-star recruit coming out of University School in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., before signing with LSU.
